column4: can anyone tell me what I need to do when an instruction shows I need to use (#) in the console?
so just type sudo before the command?
But, be aware that the command will be running with root privs.
I'm trying unsuccessfully to get my wireless running (a step by step following of the instructions doesn't work unfortunently...)   On section 3 it mentions "automatic daemon leading via modprobe"
another step or another way of loading drivers?
No, I've never messed with wireless or drivers much
rats.  Hard to learn linux without being able to research online...lol

yeah I'll check.  So far I've gone through 3 how to's with no luck.  They all don't refer correctly to the files you download, and I'm not smart enough to know what subtle changes I need to make to make it work
yeah I've been there trying to follow the step by steps all day.  No luck so far.  Thanks for trying though :)
eventually I'll either figure it out or run into somebody who knows what I'm screwing up
Yeah, that's one of the great things about Ubuntu.. there's always someone who can help you with anything :)
yeah imagine how much easier it'll be to find when I can get internet working though...lol
